document_data.caption: Prayer Alley as described by Volo, ''circa'' 1367 DR.
document_data.name: Prayer Alley
document_data.mainbody: '''Prayer Alley''' was a dead-end alleyway and courtyard in the [[Waterdeep/Sea Ward|Sea Ward]] of [[Waterdeep]]{{Cite web/Realms by Night/Part Three: The Magistree, or the Hanging Tree of Ravencourt}}
document_data.Geography:
[[File:Trollkill Street Sea CS-map.png|thumb|right|270px|''Prayer Alley (left of Heroes' Garden) ''circa'' 1357 DR.'']]
The entrance to Prayer Alley was at the eastern end of [[Aureenar Street]] on the southeast side, one door before Aureenar ended at [[Trollkill Street]]. The intrepid explorer [[Volothamp Geddarm]] described Prayer Alley as going around the central buildings of the block and ending up parallel to [[Phastal Street]], In either case, the alley ended in the southwest corner of the courtyard near the only tree on the block, the infamous [[Hanging Tree of Ravencourt]].
document_data.History: Prayer Alley got its name from a time when the area was much more dangerous, and unfortunate victims of thievery had no prayer of escaping the dead-end alleyway.
document_data.Notable Locations:
* The [[Hanging Tree of Ravencourt]]: A haunted [[shadowtop]] tree that was known to snatch up perpetrators of capital crimes that had not been caught and sentence them to death by hanging from its branches.
* [[Whistlewink's Revenge]]: An itinerant [[magic]] shop that occasionally replaced the abandoned warehouse just to the east of the tree.
